attributes.action: the NHS should not be able reject those who are felt to not lead a healthy enough life style.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Everybody in the UK pays taxes, so everybody in the UK should be entitled to access to the NHS.  If smokers and people who eat fast food are to be refused access to NHS treatment, then the government should remove all tax on cigarettes and unhealthy food.  I don't see that happening somehow.  And how long until this escalates, so that drinkers, drivers, or those with mental health conditions such as eating disorders or self-injury are also refused treatment, because their illnesses/injuries are "self-inflicted".  This is a ridiculous and unfair move by a government already taking the nanny state too far.

rejection.details: There is no such policy of denial of service.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
